Reviews.Title: Great TV, Takes a little setup to get a great picture, but looks amazing once it is done!
Reviews.Author: Zachary Dunklee
Reviews.Content: The setup was very quick and it had no issues connecting to my Wi-Fi. I had the TV up and running in about 15 minuets after its arrival at my door. Netflix is much better than it is on my xbox and loads quickly even with my slower DSL connection. I have not tried the 3D settings yet, but 2D looks great. I also have it hooked up to my surround sound and so I have no idea what the TV audio actually sounds like. I'm sure it isn't any better than any other flat screen TV.Here are the settings I used for picture quality:Start in Movie mode and change these settings:Color Temperature:Red Gain: 84Green Gain: 90Blue Gain: 100Red Offset: 110Green Offset: 100Blue Offset: 100Advanced Picture:Color Enhancement: Rich ColorAdaptive Luma: StrongFilm Mode: OffSmart Dimming: OffAmbient Light Sensor: OffThe only other change I made was to increase the backlight from 55 to 65. This just causes a brighter or darker screen. These settings take care of the yellow tint that the TV starts with and makes pictures look great. If you want it darker or lighter you can cut the color temps in half or increase them by the same ratio in order to keep quality colors as well.

Reviews.Title: VIZIO E420d-A0 - Best Vizio 3d 42" Tv
Reviews.Author: mb8873
Reviews.Content: Wow. I am totally blown away by this 500$ 3D Led flat screen Vizio tv. It has exceeded all my expectations. JD Power and Assoc calls Vizio the gold standard in flat screen affordable tv's and now I can totally see why. Vizio makes another 42 inch LCD 3d tv which also from what I have seen is a great set as well but I have to say this model is the better of the two. The LED which to me outshines the Lcd model and 2 million contrast ratio ( the other has 200,000) make this 120htz tv really pop. The color and clarity will really shock you too. I have seen alot of great tv's, my family owns all the hi end 2500$ tv's including a couple of 3d's and this tv can hang with them all. The 3D is so rich and clear and the black levels are the best out of any tv ive owned (my previous set was a sony 42" Bravia 1080 60htz flat screen for 800$). I did alot of reading before I bought a new 3d tv and really didnt feel like spending a 1000$ to get what i wanted and I have to say I am one happy guy and so will you be. The one thing you hear alot of negative reviews on is usually the audio , not on this set it is outstanding. I purchased a soundbar when I ordered the tv because of the ongoing sound issues with flat screens but when i connected the tv the quality srs surround sound that came out of this 3.5 inch thick 30lb tv blew my mind. When i eventually hook up the sound bar it will only be that added bonus but the set does not require it as most models in its class absolutely do. I am watching green lantern in 3d as I write this review and i must say it was worth the research and waiting to purchase such an overacheiver!

Reviews.Title: great product
Reviews.Author: GeetarJake
Reviews.Content: The picture on this TV is amazingly good. 3d looks great, I've used it for watching blu rays, netflix, and playing ps3, and with a few little picture tweaks you can really get a great image. There's no motion blurring at all, and the contrast is just awesome.My ONLY complaint is that the manual says to use an 8M 1.0 pitch 20mm screw to install the set onto a wall mount, however, after several trips to the hardware store, multiple conversations with Vizio Support(who also gave me those same screw specs) and some trial and error, I discovered that it's actually supposed to be 1.25 pitch. That would have saved me a few bucks, and lots of time and looking like a jackass going to the local hardware store half a dozen times buying different screws. Other than that, I couldn't be happier with this set, it works great.

Reviews.Title: Nice Picture, Terrible Apps, Clueless Vizio Support
Reviews.Author: Refuge Denied
Reviews.Content: Ordered Wednesday, May 29, 2013.  Received Friday, May 31, 2013.On Amazon this TV seems to have great reviews so I purchased it a few days ago.  This was to go into a bedroom mainly for Netflix use.When I received it I immediately started to get it set up.  I hard-wired it to my router, plugged in an HDMI cable from my cable box to the TV, plugged in the power.  After the initial setup, I tried to use the Netflix app - no option for "Yes, I have a Netflix Account", just "Unable to connect to the Netflix service - Try again or Exit".I tried the YouTube app and it worked fine.I reset the TV to factory defaults (Menu > Help > Delete Memory (Factory Restore)), but this didn't help.  In fact I tried this twice over the next 12 hours.After a search of the problem it seems Vizio has a lot of problems with Netflix.  Even if your TV works fine now, a future update (that you have no control over) may bork Netflix or other services until a new patch is released.  This can be weeks or even months in some cases I found online.I called Vizio support this morning (Saturday, June 1, 2013) and the guy gave me 2 different and unrelated reasons Netflix won't work properly.  He had me factory reset the TV a third time and still no luck.  He said it was probably a problem with my router or that Netflix was down.  I told him both my Roku and PC can view Netflix just fine yesterday and this morning and that the TV could stream HD YouTube videos just fine.  Then he said it might be a bandwidth issue.  I said the last speed test I did showed 52 mb/s down and 6 mb/s up.  That couldn't be the problem.He then asked me to plug the TV directly into my modem and let it sit over the weekend.  What??  I said I use my internet connection for work and that wasn't an option, but I reminded him that it is wired (not wireless) into the router and it CAN connect to other online services.  He then told me to send it in to Vizio (on my dime) for warranty repair.No thanks.  I told him I would just return it to Amazon and get a different brand.  This was my first experience with Vizio.  I'll stick with Samsung, LG, and Panasonic.I called Amazon right after.  The tech at Amazon had me try a few things and eventually said its faulty and he set up a return.  UPS will be out to pick it up on Monday.  Amazon is awesome!All that said, this TV DOES have a nice picture out of the box.  Tweaking it using the settings that another reviewer posted here just makes it better.  The picture looks just as good my LG LCD and almost as good as my Panasonic plasma.If you are looking for a TV with the convenience of apps, look at another brand.  If you think this is a good price for an LCD and don't need the apps, this might be a good buy for you - again, the picture is great with an HD source.** UPDATE June 05, 2013 **I ordered a Samsung UN40EH5300 the day I setup the return for this Vizio.  I received the Samsung yesterday (arrived in one day with free shipping) and everything works great out of the box.  A couple of setting tweaks and the Samsung has an outstanding picture.  I will leave a review for the Samsung after I've had it for a while and follow up with any problems if I encounter them.

Reviews.Title: Amazing picture. Okay 3D
Reviews.Author: TheDaywalker47
Reviews.Content: The picture on this TV is amazing, once you can get the settings that you like (I will post mine at the end). The 3D on this TV on the other hand is probably the worst I have ever seen. You pay an extra $20 for this version over the non 3D version and believe me you get what pay for. I also have a 47" LG Cinema 3D LED TV as well and it is half the thickness of this one with much better 3D and I only paid $650 for that one at Walmart because it is not a smart TV. The apps on this TV are okay the Netflix and VUDU work great but the amazon instant video is worthless if you have prime because it is hard to find the free movies.  It also has M-go which is completely useless if you have an amazon or VUDU account. There about 80 other apps (music, movies, news, social, sports, and games) but I don't have a use for any of them on my TV.(if you are looking for a good smart TV go with LG or Samsung they are the best). if you are looking for a LED TV with great picture for a great price than I recommend this one; however, if you do not already own a 3D TV do no make this one your first one. Plus all video and audio settings must be adjusted for each input plus 3D mode and for any smart TV video apps. Now for the best picture quality uses these settings:Picture mode: CustomBacklight. 55brightness. 50contrast 75color 60tint 0sharpness 12 (can adjust to your liking)color temp: choose custom but leave the defaultsadvance picturenoise reduction  lowmpeg nr  lowcolor enhancement offadaptive luma strongfilm. autosmart dimming  offambient light sensor  offthis will give you white whites without the yellow tint with good darks and clear edges. note: you will need to change this for each input plus 3D mode. as well as for any smart tv apps that play video (its annoying)

Reviews.Title: AWESOME TV!!
Reviews.Author: Dahlya
Reviews.Content: This television exceeds all my expectations many times over! The quality of the HD was to be expected, love the smart tv features, but the 3D is just outstanding!! Price was fantastic. Arrived quickly. Would definitely purchase another!

Reviews.Title: Great TV but not so smart.
Reviews.Author: Dusty
Reviews.Content: I just received my TV today.  Unboxing and setting up is easy enough.  Power on and follow the screens... the first thing you're prompted to do is connect the wifi.  It took 3 very smart friends, 2 hours, and 1 lengthy call to tech support to get it connected. It seems the TV only responds to super simple passwords... so we had to reset my wireless router back to factory defaults and configure from scratch to get the TV to accept the password.  More trouble than I've had from most devices.That said, Tech Support was very helpful and a pleasure to work with.  Once connected though, I find the built in apps are pretty much worthless.  The Amazon and Netflix apps are tedious to navigate.  To use the Hulu app, you need to subscribe to HuluPlus.  There's no Pandora, no YouTube.  There are a bunch of Yahoo apps that are a decade past their prime.  I don't recognize, or care about, any of the others.  Bottom line... I'll be hooking my laptop up via the HDMI and using that for web access, just like I did my non-smart TV.  So the Smart TV aspect of this box is worthless unless all you care about is streaming Amazon, Netflix or HuluPlus.. and you have the patience to click endlessly to navigate the interface. I have a USB wireless keyboard I'd like to use, but so far can't get it to work.  I think you're limited to using the remote for input.On the plus side... the image quality is awesome.  The styling is beautiful.  Sounds great.  Previews of some 3D movies are very promising... I think I'll love the 3D.  I did try the 2D to 3D function.. though I haven't figured out how to get it to work yet.  I'm thinking it will be more complicated, and less impressive, than it's worth to figure it out.I'd get this TV for the image quality and 3d alone.  The Smart functionality is just a small bonus.  I'm happy based on the price I paid.  If I paid full price, I'd expect more from the wifi capabilities.

Reviews.Title: Love this TV
Reviews.Author: Jeremy
Reviews.Content: Gave this to our son for a graduation gift.  The 3d on this thing is amazing and the apps built in are fantastic.  The remote is laggy though and sometimes seems to not work at all.

Reviews.Title: Best TV I've ever owned.
Reviews.Author: Karlos Kistaman
Reviews.Content: As the title states this is the best TV I've ever owned, and I've owned over 10 flat screens.  3D is perfect, WiFi is flawless, screen is amazing...sound is excellent....LOVE THIS TV.

Reviews.Title: Good TV, Software is glitchy and freezes.
Reviews.Author: Mike W.
Reviews.Content: Pretty good picture.  Software is a little glitchy, sometimes will freeze and ignore the remote and buttons.  The only way to restart it when it freezes is to pull the power plug from the back.  Not a huge deal, but it happens about once a week.  It might be a pain if your TV was mounted on the wall or something.  Netflix and Amazon prime work well, not really many other useful apps.

Reviews.Title: Awesome gaming tv
Reviews.Author: jro2020 "James to you"
Reviews.Content: This may be the conformation bias talking but I really like my tv.  My only real complaint is that the number of smart apps that you can install at once seems very limited and it doesn't support dlna or any sort of streaming protocol for local network based content that I can find.  The 3-d is very good and not having to charge glasses is wonderful

Reviews.Title: Best choice
Reviews.Author: Andrea Hill
Reviews.Content: I spent a great deal of time researching a new TV after making an impulse purchase on a Samsung 39" TV at Walmart(Took it back due to poor picture quality and price.) I was reluctant on getting this TV because some of the reviews. I am super glad I did  because the picture quality is superb, Vizio support is awesome, the 3D feature is great, the sound is very good, and it works super awesome as a computer monitor via HDMI. If you are on the fence about this TV I have to say I have zero regrets on this purchase. The quality and price far exceed my expectations.

Reviews.Title: Great price on a full featured TV
Reviews.Author: Marc K.
Reviews.Content: My Tv just arrived today and this is a great deal. Amazon price matched Dell's price of $508 so i got an Awesome price on an already inexpensive Tv.Pros: Great price, decent selection of apps, the remote has an Amazon instant video button(and a Netflix button). I tested the 3D function with Crysis 3 and was quite pleased. The 3D causes little to no eyestrain versus the active shutter type Tv's which can become very uncomfortable during a movie. The buttons make a very satisfying "click"(not a noise, you feel the button click) when pressed and have a very grippy rubberized finish(the remote itself is glossy plastic on the top, and matte plastic on the bottom.)Cons: Remote has very small buttons but can easily be used with one hand. For size reference, the remote is 5 3/4" by 2" or slightly skinnier but a little longer than an iPod touch. The apps are a little laggy. You have to wait a few seconds for the app bar to open, sometimes the apps freeze for a few seconds. The amazon instant app takes a long time to initially buffer(about a minute-vs 20 seconds on my computer), but it does not stutter at all while playing. I am running over Wifi, but all of my other devices are much faster when used in the same location as the Tv. The Tv has a yellow hue but Zachary's settings fixed that(they are a great starting point but i might tweak the settings a little). The glossy finish is a literal dust magnet, but now i have an incentive to clean more often.Even though the remote is tiny, it is still very usable but i wish the buttons were slightly taller(are wide and skinny. 4mm tall, 10 to 14 mm wide. The volume, channel, amazon, Netflix, and directional buttons are a little larger though.If you are still using Composite or component video, note that you can only have 1 type plugged in at a time since the jacks are shared between those two types.Finally, my Tv did have 1 stuck or dead pixel, but 1 in 2.7 million is a really small failure ratio, and it is only visible if you are within 2 feet of the screen.If you are on the fence about this, buy one, you won't regret it. The colors are rich and vibrant, the bezel is very slim(1/2"), and the 3D works great. Why pay more for the same features? Even my listed cons are minor enough for me to not even think of knocking off a star.

Reviews.Title: why did I wait so long?
Reviews.Author: Percy104
Reviews.Content: This is my first flat screen hdtv and I guess I waited until now to purchase one since the price and value reached a very attractive point.  It was easy to set up and the picture, like many others have said, was terrific...and this is with an over the air signal!  The recent PBS Bocelli concert in Portofino was extremely enjoyable to watch. Wonderfully vivid detail. The only quibble I have, and it's a small one, is that the on-screen program information doesn't allow you to see what's coming up on that channel later in the day/evening.  All told, I'm very happy with this tv and highly recommend it to anyone looking for an excellent  quality picture and features at a very attractive price.  Thank you, Amazon!

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: christopher overton
Reviews.Content: I don't right reviews but in this case I made an exception, this is the most bang for your buck that you can find. Crystal clear picture if your signal is 1080 I or p. smart features are ok and the 3d is nice but the quality of the picture rivals,Sony,Sharp,LG,Samsung at a better price for the consumer.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic product, fantastic features, fantastic price
Reviews.Author: Timothy M. Price
Reviews.Content: Vizio is a great brand with yet another great product.  I have owned a Vizio plasma for years and it is still going strong.  This is my first venture into 3D and web-enabled TV, and although I have yet to try out all the features, this TV is impressive.  The colors are comparable to my plasma (after making the adjustments Zachary mentioned), but it runs SO much cooler.  (Need things to run cool in my part of the country!)  I have mine mounted on the wall, and it looks great.I did order a second remote to have one with a keyboard on back.  Glad that I did that, and yes, it works with this TV just fine.I would order Vizio again in a heartbeat.Pros:-Price-Cool Features (3D, Web, SRS)Cons:-Power cord is a little short-No QWERTY keyboard

Reviews.Title: My wife loves it!!
Reviews.Author: TMC
Reviews.Content: My wife has been hounding me to get her a 42" 3d television. After many months of agonizing research I opted to select this model. Set up today went well, the only hiccup was trying to figure out how to use the Vizio remote (non qwerty) to input letters during the process (either the "V" key or the OK key brings up an onscreen keyboard). TV works like a charm, wireless connectivity is excellent. The "apps" updated automatically once the initial set up was completed. The picture and sound are terrific, my wife is ecstatic that I purchased this television for her (it is her Christmas present). I will update this review after my wife has spent some additional time with her gift.

Reviews.Title: Everything I Hoped For
Reviews.Author: MattC
Reviews.Content: I must say that buying this Vizio about a month ago was one  of the better decisions I've made regarding electronics.  I like everything about it.  I even like the remote even though I did order one that can be used with this model but also has a keyboard on the backside.  I like it very much too.  This set just has a great picture. There's just no other way I can express how I feel. The sound is so good that you don't have to run it through a home theater system.  I watch it sometimes using the built in sound and other times with a home theater system. Sometimes you just want to hear all the sound effects that are contained in some of the newer movies. I think this Vizio has great contrast and I like pretty much every channel that I subscribe to.  They all look good. Of course dvds look great too. They don't have to be blu rays. Blu Rays do look even more wonderful though.  I do want to mention that I bought another model for another room. It was the 40" model with a different model number. It doesn't have 3d. I ended up taking it back because it didn't have the picture this model has. This set can be placed in a room with bright light and you can still see the details in the picture. The other model was terrible in bright light conditions.  If you buy this model you will be glad you did.  I guarantee you will love it.

Reviews.Title: A Very Smart Smart TV with Great Features and Picture
Reviews.Author: C. Johnson
Reviews.Content: Fantastically featured TV. A very 'smart' smart TV. Really is plug and play in all aspects and features, from connecting to your cable and internet, to picture and sound settings, to pushing a button to instantly switch to Netflix or Pandora, to pushing a button to go from TV to DVD or PS3. Gorgeous picture. Awesome 3D with three 3D modes. Good connectivity if you won't need more than 3 HDMI inputs. The one down side?  The buttons on the remote really are too small.

Reviews.Title: Great Potential, But Serious Flaws
Reviews.Author: Chet T.
Reviews.Content: First off, I purchased this TV from another retailer for their convenience of site to store pickup because I didn't trust them sitting it outside of my house all day.Now, normally I don't review anything I purchased but I felt this was necessary. I purchased this TV mainly because I am in college and I had a pretty poor quality TV that didn't have HDMI capability. I am planning on purchasing a Playstation 4 which only outputs HDMI so an upgrade was necessary.The TV is beautiful. I didn't really know what 42 inches looks like, but it is definitely plenty big for my apartment. The few times I've used the 3D, I had good experiences. It can get a little blurry, however, so I'd give the 3D function a 7.5/10.I've never had a problem with the sound output and it definitely sounds good enough for me. I'd give it a 9/10.However, there is one big problem with my TV. It is especially noticeable when I am playing video games such as Grand Theft Auto or Fifa on PS3. Based on my research, it appears to be some sort of clouding/bleeding. In some areas of the TV, it is darker. It just doesn't look good. It is a big distraction when playing video games. Fortunately, I have a warranty and will get around to potentially getting a replacement.I will post back here when I get my replacement and see if my TV just shipped with it's own problems or if it's all models.Update:My TV was within the 90 day return policy and I have returned it for this Vizio 40 inch M series TV which I am much happier with. I think it has a better picture for sure and is thinner. I didn't use the 3D much because it wasn't super great, but I will miss it a little but the picture on my new TV is fantastic. VIZIO M401i A3 40 Inch 1080p 120Hz

Reviews.Title: Great TV except for the remote
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Creative Cook"
Reviews.Content: I really like this TV in that you can access things more directly right from theremote in one step instead of 2-3 steps like the TV's before.  The onlycomplaint is the remote is so small its hard to see the printing on the controls.

Reviews.Title: Pleasantly Suprised
Reviews.Author: Michelle B.
Reviews.Content: My husband wanted a new TV for the bedroom, and this is the model he settled on.  I liked it because it is WiFi so no wires to hook up to the internet.  He likes it for the additional features like YouTube, Netflix, Amazon Prime, and, of course, the 3D.The only downside (if there is one) is that it uses Yahoo.  I'm not a fan of Yahoo, so there are features that we don't use at the moment because we really don't want to open a Yahoo account JUST for a TV.

Reviews.Title: Bang for the Buck!
Reviews.Author: Melvin Dawson
Reviews.Content: I got a sweet deal on this feature packed TV. This baby has it all: 3D, 1080p, 120hz, great contrast ratio, wireless connectivity. Everything a big boy needs for the 2014 football season. :) The picture is spectacular, with a gauntlet of adjustable functionality. I haven't tried 3D with it yet, but I will soon. Setup is easy, but with so many options it can truly test a fellow. Nevertheless, once you set it up, you won't be disappointed. I also love the thin border.After signing up with Netflix through the unit, I was stoked on how fast it loaded my pages. Network freeze-ups were none existent (depending on the speed provided by your ISP). I had no problems at all with FiOS.BTW - You can also purchase the remote control with built-in keyboard on the back. A true "must have"!

Reviews.Title: ALL STARS FOR VIZIO TV
Reviews.Author: Laura  Cantrell, Miss
Reviews.Content: The 3 D aspect is blowing my mind!!!  It is just fabulous.  Company did a great job.Thank you very much.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV.
Reviews.Author: Jim Thomas
Reviews.Content: I did not need or want a larger TV as my living room is a bit on the small side. However, I did want a 3D Smart TV with WiFi. And this unit fits the bill perfectly. It is crisp, and clear, and the 3D effect is breathtaking. I have yet to use the WiFi as I cannot get it to connect to my home network. However, I think that is an issue with my current password, and not the TV's fault. I would highly recommend this unit to anyone looking for a mid size TV.

Reviews.Title: Setup Difficult for Non-techie -- Not Your Father's Old TV
Reviews.Author: Noname
Reviews.Content: My husband chose this Vizio TV because of all the TV's at the warehouse store that fit our cabinet, he liked the picture on this one.  Now, we're not AV geeks.  We just want to watch TV, so the 3D feature is just a bonus we may never use.  Most of the other smart features will go by the wayside, but I have Amazon Prime and was excited about that.My husband put it up after we got it home and promptly declared that it "doesn't work."  Now, if you're old school and just want to plug in the antenna, it's not that easy anymore.  I didn't see whatever he saw at startup because I wasn't there.  He said it was just a blank screen, though the quick start guide said there would be a setup screen.The fix was easy.  He hooked up the cable box, but he didn't scan the channels.  That's all it took to make it work.Connecting the TV to Amazon was super simple.  First, I set up the network through the menu.  Then, I hit the Amazon button on the remote and it took me through all the steps to set up my account on Amazon.  I was up in minutes.  I am so happy I can finally watch my Prime Instant Videos on TV.The audio was set to TruVolume On by default.  I think it was meant to keep the volume steady and not so loud during commercials, but it doesn't help so much as annoy.  My daughter complained that the audio kept getting louder and softer all over the place.  I fixed that by turning off TruVolume.Lastly, I wish the TV would just turn on.  Instead, it now has to boot up.  I guess that's the cost of it being smart.  It needs to think, but once it's on, it's great.Overall impression: good picture, may be a problem to set up for the less techie crowd, turn off TruVolume, love my Amazon Prime Instant Videos!

Reviews.Title: Nice budget buy
Reviews.Author: Ching-feng Au
Reviews.Content: I just moved to a new place and decided to get a second TV for bonus room. After some survey, I pick this one. After place the order with free shipping, it actually arrived my door the 2nd day it shipped! Amazing.The set up is easy. There are 3 screws on the stand. Easily installed with the hex wrench come with the package. Turn on the TV with remote, answered some questions, that's about it.* ok, have to mention one thing here. The remote is not the most sensitive one and to enter information like e-mails did take some effort. I wish it support usb keyboard *I was surprised that although it has the logo of Youtube on the box, I didn't see it on the app list. I tried netflix, easy enough to use. Turned off.The next day when I turn on the TV, I found that are several more apps being pushed to the TV, including Youtube and Skype. Youtube is easy to use, skype... totally unusable unless you buy the expensive Vizio webcam that is actually discontinued on VIZIO web site.I'm not a big 3D fan but I tested the 3D function with some youtube clips (search yt3d and you can find a bounch). It works ok. If you sit on the couch facing the TV, it feels like in movie theater. But if you stand in a bad angle you see double images.For the price I still think it's a good buy. And one of my friend who is a designer praise the thin edge design.

Reviews.Title: OMG - Wish I had purchased sooner
Reviews.Author: Ron Coleman
Reviews.Content: I am on the 3rd day of the great TV and can't believe the quality. Setup, including WiFi, took a whole 5 minutes. Picture quality is outstanding so I thought it could not get any better until I fired up the 3d and watched the world come straight toward me. I had previously purchased a 3d BluRay player for the day my old TV went out. I popped a 3d disk in and all I can say is WoW. Netflix also has 3d streaming and it works beautifully with this great TV. The Apps are plentiful and you can download more via on screen prompts. The only issue I have at all is the cheap 3d glasses. They have a center seam which is rough and begins hurting your nose, looks like they need sanding...however they are the same style as you get at the movie theater and since I forgot to turn in a pair one day, they work the same with more comfort. Buy this one, LED, 3D for under $500, you just can't beat that.

Reviews.Title: Great TV but no wall mounting bolts included
Reviews.Author: dg113
Reviews.Content: The TV is incredible value for money. Found mine at a local big box store for $699. That would be a great value for any 1080p 120hz 55 inch LED, let alone a Smart one with 3D to boot. Setting up Wifi and watching Netflix in HD took all of 30 seconds. So much easier than going through an Xbox/Roku/bluray player. Interface is nice and fast. What more could you ask for for the money?Well, 4 $.50 bolts, actually. If you want to mount this on your TV, you'll have to find them yourself. There were none in my box. Neither the instruction manual nor the back of the TV specify which bolt size you need, either. If you try to look it up, a few sources say to you need M6x20, 1.00 pitch. So that's what I went out and got. Wrong! M6 is too small. After another trip to the hardware store, I got the right size.The CORRECT size is M8x20, 1.25 pitch.TV is mounted now and I couldn't be happier. Really makes you question dropping more on a Sony/Samsung. It is that good.

Reviews.Title: No frills 3D.
Reviews.Author: Nobody
Reviews.Content: This has a sharp, clear picture and the 3D is not hokey in the least.  I was amazed at how far this technology has come.You still need the glasses (included) for 3D but the effects are truly stunning.  As for regular 2D viewing, the picture is great and easy to see in a wide variety of lighting.  This was a good TV, especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: Great TV @ a great price.
Reviews.Author: Jerry Isbell
Reviews.Content: Purchased this last year and it has been great. The passive 3D is awesome. Glasses a very light and comfortable. I have a 73 inch Mitsubishi  DLP that requires active glasses and the 3D is just as good. I would defiantly buy again.

Reviews.Title: Ok with Caveats
Reviews.Author: 3d home theater
Reviews.Content: I didn't get mine through amazon, this is just about the TV, but wanted to share my experience.  I've had one of these in my bedroom for some time, hooked up to an inexpensive sony 3d blueray/surround system.  In the bedroom the results were quite good.  We keep the intensity pretty low at night, but the few times we have bumped it up it seems very bright, I get almost direct sun near the TV in the morning and it overpowers that well.  Images are sharp and clear and when it works (see below) the 3d is really good.Since we have had it Netflix has done system upgrades a couple times and in two cases it took some time to see a firmware update on the TV to catch up.  it's always getting to the first Netflix screen that causes issues so I learned to simply move past it by returning to something previously viewed.  Works, but it's a bit quirky.The real issue with mine is that about 2 months after it I started using it with a couple HDMI devices, and then after a short time they quit working.  Since it was just sporadic use I didn't really notice, but then later I wanted to watch a blue ray and discovered that the HDMI port the sony was plugged into was also dead.  I am still using it as a TV and to watch Netflix in the bedroom, but there are no working HDMI inputs.  I've not had a piece of equipment fail in any of our systems (I have a couple large projector/theater rooms in the house and a couple large screen TV setups running with multiple device systems, so I think I know what I am doing.  (course what do I know).  Anyway, I'm not sure if I'd buy another one based on my experience with that, but then it is still serving it's primary intended purpose so I will give it three stars.

Reviews.Author: Bruce Kaufman "Bruce G Kaufman"
Reviews.Content: This TV, cheaper than other TV's in its class has a magnificent picture and that has to be the single most important thing about a TV.  There are a multitude of controls to make fine adjustments of all aspects of the video.  The built in speakers are reasonably good, but I often direct the sound to my surround system.  Hookups are simple and easy.  There are 3 HDMI connectors which for me will be enough.  The TV is "Smart", which means it connects to the Internet and offers you a series of apps supplied by Vizio, some with familiar names, like Yahoo, Netflix and Amazon.  The streaming works very well including for 3D.  The TV comes with 2 pair of passive 3D glasses that have worked well off of streamed You Tube 3D videos as well as on films like Avatar 3D played through the connected Blu-ray player.  I have but one caveat.  The remote must be aimed quite accurately to the sensor on the TV to get a response, though this is not annoying enough for me to lower the five star rating.  I have learned that Vizio is an American company with stateside tech support which is a big plus for me as well.  A 42" hi-def 3D TV with Smart for under $500.  I am elated.

Reviews.Title: Review for 3D PC Gamers
Reviews.Author: Stephen Sedita
Reviews.Content: The only thing I have attached to this TV is my computer.  First off, screen quality is good but not great.  Compared to a $400 Samsung 40" 5000 series the picture quality was clearly better on the Samsung with much less adjustments needed.  That being said, with some adjustments the TV still looks good, just not great.  I had an older version of this same TV, E3D420VX, which unfortunately did not survive a recent move.  The only thing better about the older model was the remote, which had a full keyboard on the back and is much easier to use for the smart TV apps than the remote included with this TV.  Just like the old version though the user interface is somewhat sluggish in response and the remote has to be pointed directly at the TV to work.  The smart apps can also be a little sluggish or clunky to navigate, but I only ever use the amazon video app anyway and with my old qwerty remote I can search for stuff easily enough.  I definitely recommend either buying a universal remote that has a keypad or trying to find the one that came with the older Vizio model.  I've read some people have success with wireless USB keyboards but haven't tried that myself.3D on this unit is actually even a bit better than my old one.  I've got a few 3D digital movies and the depth seems just a touch better on this unit.  3D gaming has a ton of caveats.  I have an AMD 7950 so for 3D I'm limited to using an HDMI cable and its stuck at 24FPS.  That is noticeable for fast paced games that weren't designed for 3D.  But for games designed to support 3D, like Batman Arkum Asylum or Crysis 3, the 24 FPS limitation is significantly less noticeable.  And its simply freaking awesome.  I've used active shutter glasses in the past and noticed serious eye strain after more than 15 minutes of use.  With the passive tech from these glasses I experience no eye strain, none at all.  Some will point out you lose resolution, but honestly its hardly noticeable if even at all.  The immersion you get from the 3D totally outweighs the barely noticeable loss of resolution.Bottom line is that for games designed to support 3D, PC gaming with this TV is awesome (if you're video card is powerful enough).  I'd suggest for 1080p resolutions the 7950 or something in that class in bare minimum. For example I can run crysis 3 smooth as silk at high settings in 2D but if I want to turn on 3D I need to drop down to 1600x900 to stay smooth.  But I can run Batman Arkum Asylum at full settings @ 1080p in 3D and its smooth as a baby's butt.  For games not designed for 3D there can be all kinds of issues but in general most games are acceptable after tweaking.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful TV, Finicky Netflix App
Reviews.Author: J. M. Taylor
Reviews.Content: The TV has a very nice picture that you can tweak in a variety of ways to suit your needs. It also has a decent amount of presets too. The screen has a bit of a semi-gloss finish to it unlike the matte finish of my last TV, so I often have to close the blinds in the room to play a game or watch a movie.The on board sound is sufficient, but the speakers do face downwards so they don't have a bunch of depth or projection to them (at least in my apartment with the furnace running a few feet away from my living room).My issues have been mostly with the Netflix app. My router is about a foot from the TV, yet the Netflix app will randomly and frequently crash, sending the TV back to whatever input I had it on before. When it works, it works great - clear picture, good sound, responsive to control input from the remote. Tech support from Vizio has been mostly by email and it has been slow and somewhat lacking. The only thing that worked (briefly) was to do a factory reset of all apps. But it soon reverts to its old issues.The Wifi appears to register strong reception, so I'm guessing the app has some inherent stability issues. I don't know if Vizio or Netflix needs to tinker with it, but sooner would be preferable.

Reviews.Title: Incredible value for the money
Reviews.Author: Bob S.
Reviews.Content: Like many, I suspect, I have high-end tastes but a low-end budget. I have had a 30in Vizio TV that has been a real gem for four years now so didn't hesitate to commit to Vizio again.  I'm glad I did.  The TV is just beautiful.  A very tiny (roughly 3/4") trim surrounds the big, crisp, lovely screen and doesn't get in the way at all.  Easy to set up, out of the box to watching tv took all of 10 minutes to slap on the base and plug it in.  Turning it on sends you to a nice set of screens that guide you through connecting to the internet, registering and finding your input source with no lag or delay at all.  I don't use the WiFi feature as I have my router in my entertainment center and an ethernet connection will always be much faster than wifi so I have no desire to slow my self down or add headaches with Wifi.  Out of the box the image is stunningly sharp if a little yellow.  I recommend using the settings from Zachary Dunklee in the reviews on this page for a good starting place.  His settings tend to mute some of the overly hyperactive TV Store settings and cures the yellow hue, balancing everything out nicely.  I am very happy and am eager to recommend this set to everyone I know who may be in the market for a new TV.  The price is insanely low for this set, the look of the set even when it is off is slick and attractive, image quality is beautiful and transitions are very fast with none of the pixellation of older flatscreens, settings galore allow you to dial in your flavor, 3D is sharp and retains color well in spite of the gray glasses, smart functions are fun (but will soon be replaced by the Xbox One), I'll never listen to the internal speakers because this is a 42 inch tv and I have a surround system - duh (that said I've heard people are happy).  Buy this TV, you can't go wrong.

Reviews.Content: Lightweight, easy to use Television.  Setup was a breeze.  Thank you Vizio.  This item is priced to sell and has all the bang for the buck the more expensive sets have.

Reviews.Author: zzt
Reviews.Content: I'm the guy that all my friends come to when searching for new electronics.  I've always recommended the bigger boys when asked about TVs, and I'm especially partial to Panasonic plasmas.  However, when it came time to fill my bedroom with a new TV I chose this one and haven't looked back.For the price, size and list of features it's a great fit.  The bright, colorful picture could benefit from better black reproduction, but I can't complain too much at this price.  3D is just an added benefit.  Fun for kids movies with my daughter.

Reviews.Content: This TV works very well.  The picture is fantastic, but without the PAL (British TV) sort of look you get out of most 120Hz LED's.  My only complaint is that it that's a particularly long time to start up.  Not horribly upsetting, but annoying. Could use a couple more HDMI ports, but 2 it usually enough. Reviews.Title: Great Picture, but some other features are lacking....
Reviews.Author: J. Weber
Reviews.Content: Purchased primarily for gaming.  First, the picture quality is fantastic, i have no complaints at all on the image this tv has -- it's excellent.  It's currently hooked up to an XBox One and the graphics are outstanding.  The 120Hz refresh rate is great for gaming.Okay, the downside (and why i give it 2 stars).  The firmware (the software that runs the tv) is agonizingly slow!!  At times it takes up to 15 seconds to switch between inputs!  That's simply unacceptable on a TV this day and age.Additionally, the wireless network connection will not stay connected.  When you go in the menu and select a network, it connects with no problem.  However, later on, if you press the Netflix button....you get an error saying that it cannot connect.  You can go back in the menu, re-connect to wireless, then back to Netflix and it "usually" works.  Again, unacceptable for a "Smart TV".The 3D feature seems to work fairly well -- nothing like the big screen in a theater, but definitely watchable.If I had it to do over, I would spend the extra money and go with an LG or Samsung.

Reviews.Title: Very Pleasantly Surprised!
Reviews.Author: Patricia Ranney
Reviews.Content: First, let me start by saying that my main TV is high-def LED SONY, which I love. I had a 26-inch VIZIO in my bedroom, and it had a great picture, but I often use closed captioning and the on-screen channel guide, and I simply couldn't read anything because the print was too small. I didn't want to spend a lot of money on a second TV, but I needed something a lot bigger than a 26-inch, so I suspected that VIZIO was the way to go. It was definitely the right decision. The picture on this set is brighter and crisper than my SONY -- the quality is certainly as good as the SONY. The sound is better than the SONY. It weighs less than the 26-inch VIZIO, which is about 3 years old at this point. It was extremely easy to set up -- and I am NOT a technical person. The inconvenience of not having a QWERTY keyboard in order to do set-up is just that -- an inconvenience and nothing more because you won't need to do it again. The Netflix app is fantastic -- much easier to simply push a button than work your way through a Roku box procedure, which I have to do with my SONY. I had called VIZIO support for what turned out to be a problem with my cable box, and the woman at the support center was wonderful. She also registered my TV. Again, this is a second set, and my demands are few other than a great picture that allows me to read words and good sound; and the sound is much better than I would have ever expected. Because it was less than another $50 to upgrade to a 3-D "smart" TV, I did the upgrade, and it's well worth it, as I can access news from the internet and use the pre-installed Netflix and Amazon apps. There are 4 ports that allow me to hook up my cables from either the side or the back. I haven't tried watching anything in 3-D yet, so I can't comment on that, but the set did come with 2 pairs of glasses, and if I need extra glasses, I only need the cheap ones, not those expensive electronic glasses. I bought through the Amazon Warehouse -- just like I did with my SONY -- and buying "like new" meant that there was a VERY slight scraping on the original box! Quite frankly, with both of my TV Warehouse purchases, the boxes were in better condition than any box I've seen in a store! I wouldn't dream of buying a TV any other way, as the price is outstanding, and the service is great.Unless something goes terribly awry in the next few months (and I do expect that this TV should last me at least 5 years in order to maintain my 5-star rating), I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to anyone. I've been a SONY advocate for more than 30 years, and the VIZIO is solid competition.

Reviews.Title: Amazing!!
Reviews.Author: Luis Javier Mijares
Reviews.Content: This is my forst Vizio TV ever... And I tell you, it is amazing. And the price is more than worth it for a 3D smart TV... I am very glad with it

Reviews.Title: awesome.
Reviews.Author: Don
Reviews.Content: This is the best TV I bought so far. Having owned previous Vizio TVs I was a bit hesitant on purchasing this one. The early Vizio LCDs had poor picture quality and I was taking a risk on this one because I wanted to give 3D TV a shot and didn't want to spend too much money on it. This is on par with similar Samsung and Sony models that cost significantly more. I can play movies directly off a hard drive without any problems. The built in wifi and apps are excellent and the digital tuner works great with my Mohu leaf.I like the fact that it has passive 3D and the glasses don't cost much. The only thing I would change is having a QWERTY remote standard with it. Entering details during the initial set up was a drag when you have to select every letter using the arrow keys. Also a softer touch remote would be great. The buttons on this are a little stiff and noisy.Other than that minor flaw, I have to say that this is the best TV I've owned. So far only watched side-by-side 3D movies off a hard drive but will be getting a 3D Bluray player so that I can experience the true capabilities of this.I don't see the picture quality other reviewers are complaining about and the presets work fine for me.I have to say that Vizio really impressed me this time and I will not hesitate to purchase another TV through them.

Reviews.Title: Great product from Vizio with reasonable price
Reviews.Author: RajB "Raj"
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I tried anything else than LG. I have been always a LG fan starting from washing machines to refrigerators to Split ACs. For the first time I tried something else and surely not disappointed. Its slim but not ultra slim like some of the LG and Samsung models. Its super light. Picture quality is awesome. Note you might have to do some settings on both TV and Satellite receiver initially.Internet Apps are ok (note there is no Youtube and rest all apps need subscription)..I am an Amazon Prime and watch movies once a while using amazon app. It detects connection speed and automatically adjust the movie quality from SD to HD.I would suggest using N router with at least 150mbps speed.Setting up wifi was easy and straight forward. I have not yet tested the 3D feature so can not comment about it.Comparing the prize + size + screen technology (LED) + Internet/Smart + 3D I think it is the best deal one could have...One thing which lack in this TV is the VGA port - It comes with limited ports (3HDMI and one Component). It does not have VGA, so if you have Ipad/iphone with VGA adapter or wants to connect laptop, you cannot unless you use VGA to HDMI converter.-------------------05/07/2013 Update - I mentioned earlier that it does not have Youtube App. I was wrong. It was not pre-installed on my TV, but I was able to install it using application settings. There are tons of other apps you can install.

Reviews.Title: good value for the money
Reviews.Author: AlwaysFlying
Reviews.Content: I purchased from Costco.com:  lower price, second year warranty extension included, Concierge tech service (which I haven't had to call on this TV) and a 90 day return policy which removes risk on a purchase decision you might quickly regret. Just take it back to your local Costco if you change your mind within 90 days.  This isn't a Costco ad but sounds like one! As to the televison we are very happy. We found the set-up of this TV to link our Amazon Prime account was quite easy. The internet access set up was as easy as selecting our wireless network on the set up screen and entering a couple of lines of information taken from our router label. We have viewed a Prime movie and it worked as expected. I don't have a wireless USB keyboard to test but the reviews lead me to believe the remote is the only input option.  The remote as an input device is clunky and somewhat tedious but it will eventually get the job done. We have older A/V equipment and the older TV we replaced had many more inputs/outputs.  It was a bit of a challenge to get all the goodies working together. I did have to buy some RCA jack splitters to allow the TV audio output to share an AUX input in to our home theater system with a turntable (no HDMI input option, that's how "old" my home theater is). I had to get the TV working in the home theater or we were stuck listening to Prime or web video through the TV speakers. Only my DVR had HDMI and that is a great system, one cable and you are done.  I jacked in my laptop using an HDMI cable and the TV displayed exactly as expected. The challenge on this TV is selecting the appropriate display settings.  This will take some study to understand and to adjust the settings to match our preferences.  The TV audio on it's own is so so, you can't expect much out the tiny speakers. Vizio knows most customers have home theater or will buy an accessory sound bar. Overall I love this, it replaces a 10year old Akai which weighed over 100 pounds and was working.  I dropped that off at Goodwill yesterday and the comment was "that's what used to be called a TV"! There is not much comparison to the old technology vs this new LED web enabled tech.  For $500.00 I don't think you can go wrong on this Vizio.

Reviews.Title: NOT DLNA Compliant or Certified
Reviews.Author: Steller
Reviews.Content: Some "Smart" TV's are smarter than others. I was unaware when I bought this TV that Visio products are largely NOT DLNA compliant or certified yet. What this means to you as a customer is that you will be unable to stream video, pictures, or music from a local source on your home network via wireless. Samsung and Sony have done this for years and I guess I assumed since this was a wifi capable "Smart" TV, it would do it also. Now, if your looking for typical TV functionality, this TV may be just fine for you. But, why would you limit yourself if your going to make a fairly large investment in a TV that you would like to use for 5 years? For example, the reason Iphone and Android Smart phones are so popular, is the apps. Visio doesnt seem to think they are that important for TV's yet. I called and spoke to their management personally yesterday after trying to get PLEX or Twonky to work on a local network. Both Samsung and Sony not only support DLNA, but they also have their own way of allowing additional application integration.As I said, this TV might be great for you. My only advice about Visio is this is becoming an application centric world. As a consumer, you will be using more any more applications. Even though the 32" is not 3D, I thought that this gives me an opportunity to do a Vizio to Vizio comparison.First, I still love the picture for both of them. With adjustments mentioned and my fine tuning to my preference, the 42" matched the 32" in picture quality and clarity. I did not notice any bleed by the LED on both. The sound quality seemed comparable. The set up was easy for both and my Netflix and Amazon is easier to bring up on the 42" than the 32" with the dedicated buttons.So why did I give the 32" a five star and the 42" a four star...Motion blur. I don't know if it was on the 32" and since it was a smaller TV, it was less noticable or not but it is noticable on the 42". It is not something that drives me crazy or makes sports less enjoyable but it is there. I am not sure if there is anything I can adjust to make it less noticable or eliminate it. I am not a electronics whiz so I am hoping someone will post here something I can do to fix it. I would not consider it a deal breaker because of the positives including the price. I upgraded from a 50" Samsung, and this was definately worth the upgrade.  If you are only using it for 2D, the Ultra HD on this screen is amazing, sound quality is every bit as good as Samsung.  I also play 3D movies through my laptop. So I bought an HDMI 1.4 cable, made sure I had a 3D compatible video card on my laptop, and PRESTO, I'm watching 3D movies and loving it.  The refresh rate is PERFECT.  I was a bit skeptical when I read reviews about refresh rates, because I started to get buyers remorse thinking I should have spent extra for a 240Hz TV.  No, forget that hogwash.  I watch like 5-12 hours of TV a day [don't judge me], and I love a perfect HD picture and a smooth picture, so I know what Im talking about.  This is a perfect TV.  The 3D is very enjoyable.  I've found PowerDVD 13 3D combined with 3D Nvidia Vision 3D Player are great for playing my 3D movies.  This TV is a Gem.  Very happy I upgraded, worth every cent.

Reviews.Title: As usual Vizio wows on image and 3D, yawns on audio.
Reviews.Author: Dustin
Reviews.Content: The built-in speakers are kinda flat with not much bass to speak of, so I ended up buying a sound-bar.  This is actually typical of Vizio. The picture and the 3D are really nice, though, and the TV is light enough to mount without needing a second person (assuming you're not mounting over shoulder height).  It doesn't come with any mounting hardware, you'll need a kit with M6 screws.  The Apps are nice, but the selection is REALLY limited; I basically only use Pandora, Accuweather, Netflix, maybe YouTube if I don't feel like whipping open the laptop, and the usual TV functions.Inputs are 2 HDMI, 1 component (RGB), Coax/RF/RG6 on the back, and one HDMI and a USB on the side (with an optical digital audio out).  If you own an older Wii, you will need a different cable to hook it up, there is no composite video jack (the yellow RCA jack). Same with the old-old-XBox, you'll need the component video cable.  Any newer system with HDMI is no issue.One pet-peeve:  The built-in TV speakers can be shut off through the menu, BUT will come back on when you turn the TV off and on again.  I need to get a hold of someone in tech support to try and fix that.  Also the digital audio out (optical) is ALWAYS ON when enabled through the menu (it can output PCM or Dolby), and muting the TV does NOT mute the digital audio, you have to mute the device receiving the audio.  Not ideal, but with the right universal remote, livable.

Reviews.Title: Very Satisfied
Reviews.Author: Valkryn Exodius
Reviews.Content: I'm going to be honest, at first I was very skeptical about the picture quality of this TV but after messing around with the video settings my initial feelings towards it did a complete 180. Here's what I personally recommend for optimal picture. First, follow Zachary Dunklee's instructions for adjusting the color temperature and make sure you do this under the "custom" option. Outside of that my personal settings are as follows and they've been working quite well for me:PicturePicture Mode: GameBacklight: 100Brightness: 50Contrast: 50Color: 50Tint: 0Sharpness: 4Advanced PictureNoise Reduction: HighMPEG NR: HighColor Enhancement: Normal (setting this to rich like Zach recommended made certain colors too dark or too bright for me)Adaptive Luma: StrongFilm Mode: OffSmart Dimming: OffAmbient Light Sensor: OffI would also like to comment on the sound quality of this TV since it is probably the best built in sound I have ever heard in an HDTV. Granted there aren't many cases I can compare this to since many of the other HDTVs I've seen have been equipped with sound bars or systems. I can say that the sound is better than the HDTV I had before this one. The only complaint I have with this TV so far is that you have to adjust the video settings for every input which is a real pain. All in all though, this TV is awesome and you would be hard pressed to find a better TV for the same price.PS: Please let me know if there is inaccurate information contained in this review and I will fix it. Thank you!

Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: This Tv is awesome. Its sleek light and very easy to set up. This is my first 3D led hdtv and my first 55 inch tv and I couldnt be happier.  The pictire is very crisp and rich, the 3D is amazing, and the speakers arent bad for such a slim TV. The only gripe I had was that the specs said it came wiyh a qwerty keyboard remote and it didnt. Reviews.Title: A lot of TV for very little $$
Reviews.Author: Craig Walker
Reviews.Content: When I started hunting for a new TV for my living room I was not in the market for a 3D...I wasn't even in the market for a smart TV but when I came by this which claims to be a true 120hz 3D Smart TV I had to bite. The Vizio E420d-A0 is a phenomenal bang for your buck, so many features for such an entry level TV price.I hadn't had my Cable box set up yet in my apartment so when I received the TV So I had no way of testing it's abilities aside from my Xbox and let me tell you; the picture quality was excellent!  I later got my HD set up and introduced a 3D Blu-ray player to my arsenal and WOW!Only think I don't quite get is under regular viewing, it doesn't appear to ever hit that 120hz threshold.  In 3D it's very clean and crisp and I can def. pick up on the 120hz display but otherwise it seem more like an almost 120hz.  Then again, HD TV with Comcast only displays in 720 so I don't get to take advantage of it's true HD a majority of the time.Whenever I have friends over and they ask about the 3D I put the below trailer on for them and everyone is blown away.  Remember, in life you get what you pay for, while yes it says smart 120hz 3D TV, take it with a grain of salt.  This is still a great deal, but if you were to go toe to toe with a higher end TV (Samsung, Sony or Panasonic with true 120hz) you'll notice a slight difference, not large enough to justify the additional $2-300 spend.If you really want to experience the beauty of this picture and display, hook up a Blu-ray or find some true HD content on YouTube; it'll blow your mind how crisp this picture is.

Reviews.Title: Unbeatable Price
Reviews.Author: Lovestoshop777
Reviews.Content: First of all, the 3D is amazing! I have a ps3, and ordered Avatar, Monsters Inc., and Ice Age Continental Drift in 3D with this TV. Wow! Avatar really is amazing on 3D. I need to purchase the active shutter glasses now. The regular theatre glasses that come with the TV are great, but the electronic glasses will fix the problem of having to be in front of the tv, which you would get with any 3D TV. One problem I did find, I put on the Blu Ray "Rio" movie, and you can see blur each time there is movement. This is disappointing, but the good thing is that it does not happen with all movies to where you notice it. I looked EVERYWHERE, and no place could compete with the price and features of this TV. I play Black Ops 2 on the ps3, and my Kill/Death ratio immediately improved. I used to use a 32" Vizio, but this is much better than that one. I really loved the TV. I did not use any of the settings recommended by the other people. I preferred the Vivid setting with the sharpness lowered a little bit down to 10. Thats it. It looks much better and brighter like that to me. Great buy!

So we LOVE the image and price, it's destined for the summer home and the 55" VIZIO will be here next week,

Reviews.Title: Vizio 42" for a PC - Lil Tricky
Reviews.Author: Justin D. Lewis
Reviews.Content: OK first I use this LED as my monitor for my computer. I came from a Toshiba Regza 42" which I loved to this. When I first hooked it up I didn't like the picture quality at all it was dull and it sucked badly.  Here is what I did (remember this is for a PC setup) - when hooked up to a computer (gtx 570 - my card as an example) you MUSTTT go to Nvidia Control Panel - Adjust desktop color settings - at the bottom you will see content type reported to the display - set this to Full-Screen Video (this will enable advanced picture options)If you get weird colors shutoff your computer and tv, restart your computer and then turn on the display. Now going from dull and sucky to beautiful on a PC this is what I did.In picture on the LED -I set picture mode to custom -Backlight - 100Brightness - 50Contrast - 50Color - 50Tint - 0Sharpness - 8Hit More -I put color temperature on custom - Cool sucked in my opinion - it's not original PC in my eyes.on custom it should be different than cool but all color gains and offset should say 128.Hit Advanced picture -Noise Reduction - OFF - always off on a PCMPEG NR - OFF - always off on a PCColor Enhancement - Rich Color (it's gorgeous)Adaptive Luma - Strong (this is the biggest impact on the TV It actually makes it a 2grand TV)Film Mode - OFFSmart Dimming - OFFAmbient Light Senor - OFFNow it is set for a PC with very very close to a 2 grand display in picture quality.  This TV honestly does rock.

Reviews.Title: Well worth it for 3D
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: With a $530 price tag you really can't do better than this. (3D LED 120hz w/Apps)  This is a GREAT TV!  Sleek and stylish.  The passive 3D is the way to go.  Have used active and I noticed eye fatigue.  The 3D with this set is clear and crisp without any ghosting.  I have watched approx 10 movies in 3D ranging from animation to live action and they all look great!  Good for small to medium sized rooms.

Reviews.Title: Great Value can't beat it
Reviews.Author: MJ
Reviews.Content: I purchased this tv 3 days ago and I am very satisfied with my purchase, where else are you going to find an LED 42in 1080p 120hz refresh rate 3D smart tv for $519.99?? I was a little nervous at first because of the grainy picture the first day when using it but these tv's need a little warming up out of the box to get adjusted the next day everything was perfect with the exception of some picture settings as listed in one of its reviews, highly recommend following the user suggestions in movie mode etc. I'm confused on some of the 3D settings can someone please help my out? 3D works great on my Comcast on demand 3D purchases but when playing amazon 3D movies there is something off even when adjusting settings to any of the 3D options do I need special 3D HDMI cables? Any help would be appreciated! also smart features work great comes equipped with YouTube which comes in awesome btw, I actually purchased the vizio remote control with a back keyboard for $12.99 highly recommend, you will not want to use the smart features without it and no set up needed, remote works right out of the box. I love the amazon app, scrolling through movie selections are a breeze!! Way better than selecting a movie through my ps3. Pandora is not equipped even though it is displayed in the product ad, you will have to use rhapsody and purchase a monthly sub but you do get a free 30 day trial. this television looks very sharp about half the weight and thickness of my last 42in vizio which is why I needed an upgrade after 5 years, very happy with my last vizio and they are a brand I trust! Selected the free 5-8 ship came 4 business days through ups in perfect condition. Set up was a breeze connected to wifi within seconds. Will be purchasing a couple new sets of glasses though the ones in the box are a little flimsy. My only legit negative comment is the sound don't expect movie theatre surround sound unless you purchase a sound box or home theatre system! Sound isn't the best but me personally I don't have to worry because I have a surround sound system which is awesome. So if you are looking for a great value within a reasonable budget you will not go wrong with this purchase!

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price!
Reviews.Author: David Greggo
Reviews.Content: So, I did a bunch of research on a new TV for my gym.  This seemed to have a bit of overkill for my purposes, but I was curious to see what the extra features are like.  However, DON'T buy this TV for the extra features if you don't have a blue-ray player with 3D capabilities or you won't be able to use the 3D functionality.  Also, the "SmartTV" isn't so smart in my opinion.  For these 2 reasons, I gave it 4 instead of 5 stars because the price is so low, but I can't really use these features.  I wanted to have internet access on the TV, but Smart TV doesn't necessarily mean that.  It means, you can use the pre-loaded "apps" that come with it.  I wanted to be able to use my spotify account to play music while working out and I wanted it to be able to watch movies if I'm cycling indoors for a couple of hours.  However, all in all, this TV is GREAT for the price! The picture looks great and the sound is ok.  It could use an external sound system if you really care about sound quality.

Reviews.Title: Amazing TV for the price!
Reviews.Author: Tony
Reviews.Content: I've had this hdtv for a few days now and am truly impressed by it. Paired with my Sony blu ray player, the 3d is definitely cinema quality and the image remains pristine throughout with no pixelation or ghosting even during fast, high energy scenes. I had no problems connecting the tv to wi-fi or using the on screen apps. I'm not one that needs to be constantly connected 24/7 so I gave this feature a test run just to make sure it works and it worked perfectly for me.I'm also a big fan of all the picture and audio options the tv includes. Not only do you get the basic color, contrast, tint, etc. functions but it also includes individual color gain and offset options along with a built in equalizer for the audio and several modes to choose from.I also have an hd cable package and the quality of channels varies with some looking outstanding in their clarity and others only being ok. I know much of this is due to what the program was filmed on but I thought I'd mention it for any new comers who may think that hd programming automatically means eye popping excellence across all channels.For the price, this HDTV is unbeatable with all the features it includes, some of which are absent from tv's costing double or triple the price!Great job, Vizio!

Reviews.Title: Just an OK TV
Reviews.Author: bishoparc
Reviews.Content: I needed to replace the TV in our bedroom as I was moving that TV to my new office space.  I didn't want to spend a lot of money so I went with this Vizio 42".  Needless to say, you get what you pay for.  This Vizio is no where near as sharp as either my 3 year old Samsung LED/LCD TV or my 7 year old Sony LCD TV.  I've seen several posts with recommended picture settings in the reviews here but those didn't really make that much of a difference so I just went back to default (other than turning off the automatic dimming features as they totally suck on this TV.)  It's good enough for me to deal with in the bedroom because we don't watch TV in there a whole lot but overall I would say if you can afford it, buy a Samsung or a Sony and avoid Vizio.  The passive 3D glasses do work well though and I do like the fact that you don't have the flickering active 3D glasses like my Samsung (but I don't watch a whole lot of 3D so not a huge deal.)Overall, it's just an OK TV for the money.  I've contemplated sending it back and getting a 40" Samsung but I'll probably just deal with this one.**Update**As others have said I now have to agree as well that the TV takes way too long to turn on.  It's usually 10-15 seconds before you get an actual image on your TV.  It's not a huge deal but it is annoying.

Reviews.Title: YOU MAY THINK YOU HAVE A GREAT TV, CHECK OUT MY REVIEW!
Reviews.Author: Eddie
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these TV's earlier this year.  I thought they were great as the picture looked good and everything.  Then I purchased three more units (I'm working on a special project that uses multiple TV's).  I set the new ones up and holy crap two of the TV's have super nice bright colors, and the third one has the colors of the original two that I bought earlier this year.I was puzzled and to see if the two super nice ones were just a fluke, I placed an old Insignia led TV next to all of them.  Set up a Samsung dvd player and you can tell right away that the cheaper Insignia had the same brightness as the two Vizios.  I am convinced the three other Vizios are defective.  The problem is unless you have the good Vizio next to yours comparing the quality, you will never know that you have a good one or a bad one.  For all the good reviews here, I bet many of those have the lesser quality.  And I played around with the picture settings but no use.  From the factory setting you can tell right away.The Samsung dvd player comes up on the screen with menu options when it is turned on.  You can tell day and night the difference in brightness.  The grey area on the lesser quality comes out like a grey color while the better ones show it as more of a blue color.  I am extremely frustrated with Vizio.  Do not buy this TV as you will never know which one you will get.  I will contact Vizio and let them know they have a crappy product!

Reviews.Title: WOW thanks Amazon for not putting this in secure packaging I appreciate it.

Reviews.Content: I usually don't write reviews but this should be known. I have ordered a ton of stuff from Amazon but I have always been skeptical about ordering electronics. Well thanks for proving me right. The good thing is that I received this TV in all of 2 business days and I didn't pay extra for expedited shipping so I was really excited when I got home to see my TV yesterday. I inspect every package to see if it has been tampered with, I'm just that kind of person, and I saw a hole in the box. So I crossed my fingers and prayed that it was not on the screen side of the box and to my surprise it was.Long story short the LED lights were cracked I plugged it in and the spider web happily lit up on the screen. Maybe it's a sign since I hate spiders. So you all can guess how upset I was after I rushed home from work to play with my new toy only to be dissappointed in the end.I have ordered electronics from Best Buy and never have they shipped anything, especially a TV, in it's original packaging. They have always put the TV box inside another box with those air balloon thingys to make sure that it is secure. Shame on Amazon!!!On another note I'm returning the broken TV for a refund and possibly getting something thinner than this thing. Yes it's LED and a "Smart TV" and 3D but the crap is thick and doens't look sleek at all. It looks like an old plasma from 2005. Matter of fact my old Vizio plasma was thinner than this thing. It's not heavy just bulky to me and my friend even said it's as thick as his 5 year old Sony Bravia. I guess you get what you pay for.My review is based solely on how the package was shipped and the style of the tv. It never worked to begin with so I do not know what the picture looks like or if operating it was easy and user friendly. Amazon's customer service was great they sent me a return label via email. I went to the nearest UPS store, about 5 mins from my job, the same day and had it shipped back. I had my refund within 3 business days.

Reviews.Title: What isn't reviewed as much... and it's not good
Reviews.Author: lis
Reviews.Content: The TV picture is incredible, like many reviewers are saying. Since positive reviews re the picture quality are abundant, I will review other aspects of this TV that are quite a letdown.1. The remote is not user friendly. It is very small and the buttons are tiny, like on a crackberry.2. The Amazon Instant Video app is horrible, absolutely horrible. I bought this television specifically for the Amazon compatibility, so to have such a horrific app is a major letdown. I wish that I would have read a review about it.3. There is no access, NO access, to your Amazon Prime Watchlist through the app on the television. So, you have to go to the search box every time you want to find a show you are interested in.4. Using the search function requires scrolling through the letters of the alphabet and clicking enter-- a lot of scrolling and clicking with the already sucky small remote buttons. Once you get to a TV series that you want to watch, you have to click/scroll through an annoying menu. Additionally, visually the Amazon app is quite dissatisfying and unappealing. There is no pleasant aspect to using the Vizio Amazon app.5. If you love Yahoo and you have Yahoo accounts, this Vizio TV will be great for you. There are many Yahoo apps. I am not a Yahoo fan and I do not have Yahoo accounts. And I do not wish to create a Yahoo account for the crappy apps on this TV.6. Limited offering of apps. I was very disappointed to find how few apps are offered on this TV. I was expecting access to all of the great apps that are found on Roku. A previous roommate had Roku and I loved having TED on the TV. For me, it is a disappointment that Ted is not included. Also, no Pandora. There's some music app called Rhapsody-- I'm sure many people like this app, but I feel that I should have a few choices on which music app to use. There's an entire tiny remote tiny button dedicated to an app called M-GO, but the app is not up and running; there's a message that it is coming soon.The above 6 points would have led me to investigate a different brand of television. If the above 6 points are not a problem, this is an AWESOME television. It was easy to get started and hook up to wifi-- I had the TV functional within minutes of removing it from the box. And, the picture really is incredible, especially considering the comparative pricing. I actually think the picture is superior to the last roommate's LG television that was double the price.
